articles.author: Richard Cowan, David Morgan, Bo Erickson
articles.description: The quadrennial ritual stood in sharp contrast to four years ago when a mob of Trump supporters stormed the Capitol in a failed bid to block the certification of then-President Trump's 2020 loss to President Biden.
articles.title: US Congress certifies Trump election win in ceremony presided over by Harris

articles.author: David Ljunggren, Ismail Shakil
articles.description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau will announce on Monday that he intends to step down as leader of the ruling Liberals after nine years in office but he will stay on in his post until the party chooses a replacement, CBC News reported.
articles.title: Canada PM Trudeau to announce on Monday he will step down, CBC News says

articles.author: Mark Trevelyan
articles.description: Russia said on Monday its forces had made important gains in eastern Ukraine while continuing to fend off a new Ukrainian offensive inside the Kursk region of western Russia, where a second day of fierce fighting was under way.
articles.title: Fighting rages inside Russia as Moscow reports gains in Ukraine

articles.author: Hyonhee Shin
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un oversaw a successful test of a new intermediate-range hypersonic ballistic missile (IRBM) on Monday, state media KCNA said on Tuesday, pledging to accelerate the country's nuclear and missile capabilities.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim oversees successful test of new hypersonic missile

articles.author: Maxwell Adombila
articles.description: John Dramani Mahama will be sworn in for his second term as Ghana's president on Tuesday with a fresh mandate to tackle familiar challenges, including corruption, high unemployment, inflation and public discontent.
articles.title: Ghana’s Mahama returns as president, facing old problems

articles.author: James Mackenzie, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken called on Monday for a final push for a Gaza ceasefire before President Joe Biden leaves office, after a Hamas official told Reuters the group had cleared a list of 34 hostages as first to go free under a truce.
articles.title: Blinken calls for push to get Gaza truce deal over 'finish line'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: France has identified its first case of the new mpox variant, news agency AFP reported on Monday, citing a statement from the country's health ministry.
articles.title: France identifies first case of new mpox variant, AFP reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Investigators from the Corruption Investigation Office for High-ranking Officials and police are probing allegations that Yoon masterminded insurrection.
articles.title: South Korean police asked to execute arrest warrant for impeached president

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United States accused Russia at the United Nations on Monday of funding the two warring parties in Sudan, an apparent step up from Washington's previous assertion that Moscow was playing both sides of the conflict to advance its political objectives.
articles.title: U.S. accuses Russia of funding both sides of Sudan's war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A magnitude 6.8 earthquake struck the northern foothills of the Himalayas near one of Tibet's holiest cities on Tuesday, damaging buildings around Shigatse and sending people running into the streets in neighbouring Nepal and India.
articles.title: Powerful earthquake hits holy city in China's Tibet
